data.name: Innocent Frederick Ejolu
data.title: UNDP Uganda, Team Leader - Institutional Effectiveness Programme & Focal Point UNDP Accelerator Lab
data.bio:
Over 15 years of experience as a policy analyst providing policy advise and supporting strategic policy coordination, programme design and delivery with the Cabinet Secretariat, Office of the Prime Minister, and the Prime Ministers Delivery Unit.  Also served as member of the Uganda National Board for Non-Government Organizations, and Advisor to the Governing Board of the Uganda Red Cross Society. Close to 4 years experience in the United Nations System working with the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) as a team leader in the inclusive and effective governance portfolio of programmes, Focal Point for the UNDP Accelerator Lab, Focal Point for the Spotlight Initiative  Ending Violence Against Women and Girls, and more recently as a Focal Point for the UNDP Support to Uganda to prepare, respond and recover from COVID-19. 
I have a Master of Science in Public Policy and Human Development specializing in Globalization, Trade and Development, with an Honors Bachelor of Arts Degree is in Economics and Rural Economy. 
I have post graduate teaching experience with Uganda Management Institute and the Uganda Christian University.

data.name: Calum Handforth
data.title: Advisor, Smart Cities and Digitalisation, UNDP Global Centre for Technology, Innovation and Sustainable Development

data.name: Elba Fuster Figuerola
data.title: Technical Expert - Digitalisation and Smart Cities at UNDP Global Centre for Technology ,Innovation and Sustainable Development

data.name: Berna Mugema
data.title: Head of Experimentation, UNDP Accelerator Lab, Uganda
data.bio: An innovation enthusiast driving innovative projects geared towards elevating entrepreneurs as well as driving system transformation. I am an electrical engineer (hons) by training and served 10 years in the fast-paced telecommunication environment spearheading delivery of all data projects as well as third party integration into the data network. I have also had the privilege of coordinating the National ICT Initiatives Support program, a government program designed to build and support the innovation ecosystem in Uganda. In addition, I hold a Masters degree in Business Administration.

data.name: Girma Workie
data.title: Project Manager, UNDP
data.bio: I am currently working as a Manager of a GEF/UNDP funded urban based project that focuses on achieving emission reduction through composting organic fraction of urban solid waste and developing urban green infrastructure. Prior to joining this project I have worked for the Resident Coordinator Office of Ethiopia as Monitoring and Evaluation Analyst  as well as Development Effectiveness Specialist (by delegation). In this position, I was in charge of tracking implementation of the United Nations Development Assistance Framework (UNDAF) as well as More than Six Joint Programs (JPs) and report progress to the High Level Steering Committee. This has given me opportunity to work closely with all UN agencies of Ethiopia, Multi Partner Trust Fund (MPTF) and almost all government institutions. I also have more than 8 years of experience on coordinating different sort of programs and projects as well as 2 years of teaching. My educational back ground is Master Degree in Regional and Local Development Studies.

data.name: Simegnesh Yimer
data.title: Urban Greenery Team Leader
data.bio: I am currently working as Team Leader for Green Infrastructure Development of Bahirdar City Administration since 2013. Prior to assuming this position, I have worked as High Expert in Trade and Industry Bureau of Bahirdar City for 13 years. I have also served as teacher for 10 years. My educational background is Masters Degree in Urban Planning and Management and Bachelor Degree in Economics.

data.name: Zelalem Getahun
data.title: Head of Office, Bahirdar City Administration Urban Sanitation and Environmental Protection office

data.name: Florence Kuukyi
data.title: Director of Public Health Department

data.name: Fatima Farouta
data.title: UNDP Ghana, Head of Solutions Mapping
data.bio: Fatima brings her broad experience from her various roles in research capacity in higher education and private consulting, and from management within the cosmetics and mining industries, These roles enabled her to build upon her natural curiosity and versatility by enhancing her ability to tap into situations closely and finding the human aspects to policies and theories. Fatima's particular focus has always been centred on telling the stories of those who may be ignored or marginalised due to lack of representation. Fatima holds a BA in International Studies from New York University, and an MSc in Social Anthropology from the London School of Economics and Political Science

data.name: Wudasse Berhanu Berke
data.title: Technical Expert UNDP Ethiopia Accelerator Lab
data.bio: Wudasse is a design thinking and partnership expert at UNDP Ethiopia Accelerator lab which works to tackle complex development challenges by create actionable intelligence, test solutions with national partners and create the largest and fastest learning network. Before joining UNDP, Wudasse worked designing and developing products in tech companies for three years. As a user experience design, she used Human Centred Design and research to design people centred products for emergency management and disaster recovery. During her time as research fellow, though both her graduate and undergraduate education, Wudasse experimented human behaviour and perception to design an inclusive world.

data.name: Engr. Solomon Noi-Adzeman
data.title: Director of Waste Management Department of the Accra Metropolitan Assembly
data.bio: Engr. Solomon Noi-Adzeman is currently the director of Waste Management Department of the Accra Metropolitan Assembly with over 19 years of working experience in the public service. Solomon is a Sanitation Expert with expertise in municipal water infrastructure and solid waste management. Graduated from the UNESCO-IHE Delft, in the Netherlands and the KNUST-Ghana, with double Masters Degree in Sanitary Engineering and Water Supply & Environmental Sanitation respectively. Solomon is an experienced Sanitary Engineer with excellent client and project management skills, action-oriented with strong ability to communicate effectively with technology, executive and business audiences. Solomon is inspired daily by his wife Doris and their two daughters. In his free time, Solomon likes to watch soccer, explore nature and driving.

data.title: Research and Communications Fellow, The GovLab

data.name: Joel Ayim Darkwah
data.title: Program Officer, Chemicals and Waste, UNDP Ghana
data.bio: Joel is experienced in development programme management with focus on environment, innovation, gender and social development, and partnerships. His expertise is through a mixture of professional experiences from a community-based NGO, a municipal government body, a central government institution, and an international development organization. Joel holds a Masters degree in Development Studies from the University of Ghana.

data.name: Kamilla Adgamova
data.title: Urban Resilience Programme Officer, UNDP Zimbabwe
data.bio:
Kamilla is supporting Urban Resilience programme in UNDP Zimbabwe that aims to build resilience of vulnerable urban populations to socio-economic and environmental shocks and stresses through improved access to basic social services, policy environment, market infrastructure and entrepreneurial skills. This year the programme has also been supporting Covid-19 socio-economic response and recovery in urban hotspots.
Prior to assignment in Zimbabwe, Kamilla had interned in UN DESA and then worked in Moscow office of UNIDO contributing to energy efficiency, sustainable city and waste management initiatives. She holds Masters degree in social sciences from the University of Helsinki and Bachelors in political science from Higher School of Economics.

data.name: Anne Madzara
data.title: Team Leader Poverty Reduction, Environment and Climate Change

data.name: Shamiso Ruzvidzo
data.title: Head of Exploration, Accelerator Labs, UNDP Zimbabwe
data.bio: Shamiso has experience in leading global partnerships and programmes with top tier organisations. Passionate about solving the World's biggest challenges through data and digital innovation. Her areas of expertise are: Business development, partnership strategist, resource mobilization, M4D, data and digital innovation, digital financial services including mobile electronic payments.

data.name: Melania Omengo
data.title: Manager, Citizen Voices, Twaweza

data.name: Kuukuwa Manful
data.title: Co-founder, Sociarchi

data.name: Luke Jordan
data.title: Founder, Grassroot

data.name: Semere Gebretsadik
data.title: Technical Officer-ISWM, UNDP
data.bio: With a Masters Degree in Population and Development and Bachler of Arts Degree in Geography and Environmental Science, Semere Gebretsadik has ample experience in the Urban Sector mainly on solid waste management, urban greenery development, public works, job creation, Livelihoods and Education, which enabled him to acquire sound skills in the area. Currently, he is working as Integrated Solid Waste Management technical officer for NAMA: COMPOST project funded by GEF/UNDP. Prior to joining this position, he was working in Urban Productive Safety Net project funded by World Bank as Public Work Expert focusing solid waste management, urban greenery development, integrated water shed management, infrastructure and social service.

data.name: Ketema Tessema
data.title: Technical Officer - Urban Green Infrastructure, UNDP
data.bio:
With an MA in Project Management and B.Sc. in Natural Resource Management (Forestry & Ecotourism), Ketema Tessema is adept in program/technical support, strategic planning; coordination, project risk management, monitoring and
evaluation. He has worked for Administration for Refugee and Returnee Affairs
(ARRA) as Environmental officer where his role was overseeing and supporting environment protection and management activities by undertaking EIA/EA. He has Four years experience working for United Nations Higher Commissioner for Refugee (UNHCR) as Environment Associate where his role was to support environment, energy and livelihood interventions in refugee camps and hosting areas, liaise with UNHCR partners and other organization on environmental support and coordinate Environmental Impact Assessments (EIA) and Environmental Audits (EA) in new or old refugee camps.

data.name: Amarakoon Bandara
data.title: Senior Economic Advisor, UNDP Nigeria
data.bio:
Amarakoon joined UNDP Tanzania as an Economic Advisor before moving to Zimbabwe (also serving Mauritius and Seychelles) in 2013. He is currently serving as the Economic Advisor and Head of Strategic Policy and Inclusive Growth Unit at UNDP Nigeria. He has provided policy advisory support to governments in the designing national development plans, implementation of strategies to achieve SDGs, impact assessments, integrated national financing, SDG Impact mapping and national human development reports.
Prior to joining UNDP, he has worked for the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific in Bangkok, Thailand and has served the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in the Economic Research Department.

data.name: Wadzanai Madombwe
data.title: Programme Manager, UNDP Zimbabwe
data.bio:
Over two decades of practical technical and advisory experience on programmatic democratic governance reforms, especially in Zimbabwe. Of significance, are my abilities to frame reforms, design programmes, support execution and track results. In UNDP, I superintend over various strategic initiatives, including the rollout of results based management reforms in government, execution of parliamentary support programme, enhanced policy dialogue and peace building architecture, electoral institutional strengthening and local government sector. I have made significant contributions in the design of other governance interventions on justice deliver and anti-corruption.
Team leader of a Government/ UN Cluster on Governance and Human Rights, I designed, planned and tracked the Zimbabwe United Nations Development Assistance Framework (ZUNDAF), served in several UNDP Statutory Bodies, UNDP funded project boards, UNCT Programme Management Team, as well as some private sector initiatives such as EMPRETEC (entrepreneurial development body), Advisory Group of Conflict Transformation and Public Private Partnership Fund (PPP) under then Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe.

data.name: Stephan Schmidt
data.title: Developer, The GovLab
